body:
```
helm ls --namespace=reform-scan
NAME                   	NAMESPACE  	REVISION	UPDATED                                	STATUS  	CHART                         	APP VERSION
reform-scan-blob-router	reform-scan	50      	2020-01-30 10:16:28.851853992 +0000 UTC	deployed	reform-scan-blob-router-0.0.22	1.0
```

```
helm ls --namespace=reform-scan  --failed
NAME                   	NAMESPACE  	REVISION	UPDATED                                	STATUS	CHART                         	APP VERSION
reform-scan-blob-router	reform-scan	44      	2020-01-29 14:19:37.643962942 +0000 UTC	failed	reform-scan-blob-router-0.0.20	1.0
```
I wouldn't expect --failed to return a helm release which is currently deployed. At least, that was how helm 2 was behaving. Is this a change or bug in helm 3?

Output of `helm version`: 
`version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0.2", GitCommit:"19e47ee3283ae98139d98460de796c1be1e3975f", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.13.5"}`
